thread.title: Inside Operation Sea Lion – the real-life plan for the Nazi invasion of Britain which inspired SS-GB
thread.title_full: Inside Operation Sea Lion – the real-life plan for the Nazi invasion of Britain which inspired SS-GB

author: Laurence Dodds
title: Inside Operation Sea Lion – the real-life plan for the Nazi invasion of Britain which inspired SS-GB
text:
I n September 1940, Belgian civilians visiting a beach near Antwerp were surprised to see what looked like an invasion in full swing. Platoons of German soldiers leaped from their landing craft and stormed up the sand under dummy fire, with light tanks close behind them. When the visitors asked what was going on, the German film crew explained that they were capturing simulated footage of the imminent invasion of Great Britain. Since the real landings would take place before dawn, Hitler wanted to make sure he had something to put in the newsreels.
This weekend marks the start of the BBC's new alternate history drama, SS-GB , depicting the United Kingdom occupied by and collaborating with the Third Reich. In the real world there really was a plan to invade Britain, to which the Nazis devoted significant time and resources. It was detailed, serious, and considered a real threat by the Allied...
